body:
Comment 8 by **paulo.jpinto**: 
I imagine that this might hurt other systems as well, not only Windows.

If you are uneasy to change the runtime for this, an alternate solution would be to
properly document this, or do like .Net or Modula-3 do, offer a GC API where we can ask
the GC to ignore a certain memory area, then make use of it in NewCallback, while adding
to some kind of memory pool to release later.
